result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole J Cervantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The Court orders payment of the unpaid court financial obligations. The Court grants Ms. Cervantes sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

On Case #14CF266-Count #2 the Court sentences Ms. Cervantes to:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work, treatment, and medical needs, consecutive to the sentence that is currently being served in Case #14CF176

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.



Consecutive to: sentence currently being served in 14CF176

[MK] cases #14CF176 and #14CF266 called at 2:55pm. 
Defendant Nicole J Cervantes in court, in cutsody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court and counsel clarify that the sentence in Case #14CF176 is an imposed and stayed sentence, so the Court is not proceeding to sentencing after revocation hearing in that case. 

The Court proceeds to Sentencing After Revocation in Case #14CF266 only. 
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel
Ms. Cervantes makes a statement 

On Case #14CF266-Count #2 the Court sentences Ms. Cervantes to:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work, treatment, and medical needs, consecutive to the sentence that is currently being served in Case #14CF176

On Case #14CF266-Count #3 the Court sentences Ms. Cervantes to:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work, treatment and medical needs, consecutive to Count #2

Days credit for time already served given:  0 days 
The Court orders payment of the unpaid court financial obligations. The Court grants Ms. Cervantes sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive. 
recess 3:10pm.

Case called at 11:43am [mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC and Motion Hearing]
Defendant Nicole J Cervantes in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance.

On the Defendant's 6/25/15 Motion for Leave to Withdraw as Attorney of Record:
Atty. Zarwell withdraws the Motion and submits plea paperwork
The Court accepts the withdrawal of Motion and Atty. Zarwell will remain attorney of record

DA Happ orally motions to amend Counts #2 & #3; to remove the Domestic Abuse or Repeater Enhancer language and Statutes from Information recited.
The Court grants DA Happ's motion to amend charges #2 and #3

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "No Contest" entered on Amended Count #2  and Amended Count #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Counts #2 and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--Ms. Cervantes shall engage in anger management if recommended by DOC
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No Contact with Tylor Johnson
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--Complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming, if recommended by DOC
--no acts or threats of violence
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $198 

The Court does not require a DNA sample due to date a violation

Days credit for time already served:  1 day
recess: 12:17pm

cases #14CF176, #14CF266 called at 9:22am. [MK]
Defendant Nicole J Cervantes in court with Attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
---On State's Notice to Admit Statements: after a review of the bracketed statements in the Supplemental Notice, Attorney Kramer indicates there are no constitutional attacks to any statement.
---On State's Motion to Impeach with Priors:  after hearing arguments from counsel, the Court finds that Ms. Cervantes has eleven convictions for Statute 906.09 purposes. The Court verifies with Ms. Cervantes that she understands how to answer the related questions if she testifies at trial. 
--On Case #14CF176 State's Motions in Limine #1 through #8: granted without opposition from the Defense
--On Case #14CF266 State's Motions in Limine #1 through #10: granted without opposition from the Defense

As to Case #14CF176:  the Court takes under advisement the State's Motion to Adjourn the Trial, to allow time for the State to determine whether it can have a different jail staffperson testify in place of the unavailable witness, Sgt. Handrow.  The Court requires the State to notify the Court regarding whether or not it can present the necessary witness by 4:00pm on January 23rd. 
recess 9:59am. 

NEXT:  (1) deadline of 1/23/15 at 4:00pm for State to notify the Court regarding witness availability as to the #14CF176 Jury Trial dates  (2) the 1/26/15 FSSC and 1/29/15 Jury Trial remains on the Court's calendar in case #14CF176; and the 3/9/15 FSSC and 3/12/15 Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar in Case #14CF266

[Clerk: MK]
Judge Weston presiding for Branch III Intake: 
case called at 1:45pm. 
Defendant Nicole J Cervantes appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Stephen Kramer (Attorney Kramer indicates that he foresees being retained in this case; he indicates that the Court does not need to address right to counsel at this hearing).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no direct or indirect contact with Tylor Johnson
--no presence at the residence of Tylor Johnson: 411 Wisconsin Drive, #108 in Jefferson 
--no direct or indirect contact with Daniel Clark
--no presence at the residence of Daniel Clark: 1020 Meadow Street, #4 in Watertown, WI 53094
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence

The Court indicates to Attorney Kramer that, if Ms. Cervantes is not able to retain him privately, then Attorney Kramer is to refer Ms. Cervantes to the PD to apply for representation.
Attorney Kramer requests that the case be scheduled for Preliminary Hearing, rather than for Status Conference, after the Pretrial. 
recess 1:51pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/13/14 at 9:20am  (2) Preliminary Hearing on 8/29/14 at 8:30am.
